headline.main: More Access but Less Security for Journalists
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: THE WAR CORRESPONDENTS

lead_paragraph: As the Taliban's power melted away in much of Afghanistan last week, hundreds of journalists who had been confined to territory of the Northern Alliance spread out into areas controlled by local warlords or by no one. But the wider access is coming at a price. Seven journalists have been killed in the past 10 days, including four on Monday on the road from Jalalabad. Some American television news crews have begun to pull out of unstable areas. Freshly shaven Afghans in Kabul present themselves as fixers to newly arrived journalists with plenty of cash. The journalists know they need navigational help but do not know whom they can trust.
